page.title: 03From the Past continued.
page.content: Charles Garland, who had{Moreton Hall built in 1905, was the son of the founder of "The First Natioal Bank of America". He decided upon the life of a typical'English Country Gentleman'. Unable to find a suitable country seat he had it built at a cost of Â£250,000. It included stables and woods and gardens that needed 30 gardeners.His sister decided she would like a house. Another was erected 1 mile to the south at Moreton Paddox. This house has been demolished though some of the smaller features are to be found as parts of the modern houses built on the site.These houses are currently valued at over Â£120,000. The Hall was sold in the 1920's for Â£34,000. During World War 2 it became headquarters for the Free Czech. Army and American Troops. Warwickshire C.C. bought the house in 1948 for Â£55,000.
